H0.text: Introduction of a non-native species is most likely to disrupt the natural balance in an ecosystem.

H1.text: Reduced daylight hours during winter is most likely to disrupt the natural balance in an ecosystem.

H2.text: Preventing the cutting of trees in forests is the action most likely to disrupt the natural balance in an ecosystem.

H3.text: Riverbank erosion resulting from springtime flooding is most likely to disrupt the natural balance in an ecosystem.

A4.text: Invasive species can affect the invaded habitats, communities, and ecosystems adversely, causing ecological, environmental, and/or economic damage.

A5.text: Introduced species moved to a novel habitat can become invasive, with rapid population growth, when these controls do not exist in the new ecosystem.
